Posts.Content: Apr 12, 2012 08:24AM jdwench wrote: Nomore,  Cancer affects us so much emotionally and I think during, and especially after recovery, there are these expectations that we unintentionally put on ourselves, and that can really bring us down. Whether or not you are using any antidepressants, a little physical activity and daylight on your face can help. I am still dealing with a pain situation 8 weeks after surgery, and I have those days, I don't even want to get dressed. But I've found if all I do that day is go for a walk, I feel better, maybe not immediately, but if I try to do it almost every day, it helps. Give yourself permission to not feel pressured to pretend for anyone, especially yourself. Believe me you have earned it.
Posts.Title: Running out of places to turn to for help NoMoreHL karen333

Posts.Content: Jun 7, 2012 03:33PM jdwench wrote: Hi ladies, I haven't posted here yet, tomorrow is day 16 of treatment for me. it's going ok, much more tired than I expected, just in the last couple of days. sooo glad for the 2 days off this weekend. I'll be doing 7 boosts, I have no idea what that even means, I hope they won't be worse than the regular treatments. my last day will be July 2, just in time for "independance" day.  Judy
